columndescription: This column contains relevant 4-letter code names for individual bird species (100) for the Long Point Breeding Bird Census project. Code names are identified from original data collection conducted as part of the Long Point Breeding Bird Census project by Birds Canada, and have subsequently been updated in column 'C' according to Chesser et al. (2024)
reference: Long Point Bird Observatory, 2022

columndescription: This column contains average weight for bird species according to local (Long Point Bird Observatory, 2022), or regional study (Birds of the World, 2024). The unit for individual species weight is  grams (g), and reflects averages for males.

columndescription: Breeding biome categories assigned to each species, used to summarize loss results across species groups
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Non-breeding Region categories assigned to each species, used to summarize loss results across species groups
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Taxonomic Family, as assigned in the 59th supplement of the AOS checklist
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: assignment to 1 of 4 bird groups:  landbird, shorebird, waterbird, waterfowl
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Migration category, assigned to each species:  "R" - year-round resident;  "M" - migrant:  includes partial migrants (substantial overlap of breeding and winter ranges, but some parts of range occupied only seasonally) and full migrants (little or no overlap of breeding and winter ranges)
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: identifies species in the "Aerial Insectivore" group, birds that capture flying insects while in flight
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: identifies native and introduced species across U.S./Canada (from AOS 59th supplement)
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Estimated North American population during range of years between first_year_popest and last_year_popest
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Lower bound estimated North American population during range of years between first_year_popest and last_year_popest
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Upper bound estimated North American population during range of years between first_year_popest and last_year_popest
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: beginning of the time-period to which the estimated population applies. Note for species where this first_year - last_year spans 3 years, the published estimate was reported to apply to the single year in the middle of the range, but for analysis purposes we averaged across a minimum of 3 years
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: end of the time-period to which the estimated population applies. Note for species where this first_year - last_year spans 3 years, the published estimate was reported to apply to the single year in the middle of the range, but for analysis purposes we averaged across a minimum of 3 years
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription:
Source of recent population size estimates and variances for North America, as follows:
  ACAD - Avian Conservation Assessment Database
  BNA - Birds of North American accounts, various years
  CAFF18 - Conservation of Arctic Flora and Fauna 2018 report
  FWS1317 - average of 2013 to 2017 estimates from the 2017 USFWS Waterfowl Status Report
  FWS2014 - USFWS report on Yellow-billed Loon
  NATSS15 - North American Trumpeter Swan Survey, 2015
  PIF0615 - Partners in Flight (PIF) calculated estimate, based mainly on BBS data from the years 2006-2015, as described by Stanton et al. 2019
  SeDu07 - 2007 Seaduck Joint Venture Report
  Shoreb12 - Shorebird Flyway Population Database
  WPE5 - Waterbird Population Estimates Database
see Supplemental Methods text for details
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription:
source of population trajectory for individual species in this analysis, as follows:
  BBS7017 - North American Breeding Bird Survey, 1970 to 2017
  BBS9317 - North American Breeding Bird Survey, 1993 to 2017
  CAFF - trends based on population change in CAFF 2018 report (Fox and Leafloor 2018); numbers after "CAFF" indicate start year and end year of estimates for each species, from which trend was estimated
  CBC7017 - Audubon Christmas Bird Count, 1970 to 2017
  FWS7017 - US Fish & Wildlife Service waterfowl survey trends, 1970 to 2017
  Mig7416 - Migration Monitoring of Shorebirds, 1974 to 2016
  NATS6815 - Trumpeter Swan Survey trends, 1968-2015
  SGS6817 - American Woodcock Singing Ground Survey trends, 1968 to 2017
see Supplemental Methods text for details
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: first year of available estimates for the population trajectory
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: first year of available estimates for the population trajectory
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Estimated change in number of breeding individuals over the trend period (usually 1970-2017), based on a combination of current population estimates and long-term trajectories. Median of the posterior distribution from the hierarchical Bayesian model
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Lower bound (2.5 percentile of the posterior distribution) on the estimated change in number of breeding individuals over the trend period (usually 1970-2017), based on a combination of current population estimates and long-term trajectories. Median of the posterior distribution from the hierarchical Bayesian model
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Upper bound (97.5 percentile of the posterior distribution) on the estimated change in number of breeding individuals over the trend period (usually 1970-2017), based on a combination of current population estimates and long-term trajectories. Median of the posterior distribution from the hierarchical Bayesian model
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Lower quartile (25 percentile of the posterior distribution) on the estimated change in number of breeding individuals over the trend period (usually 1970-2017), based on a combination of current population estimates and long-term trajectories. Median of the posterior distribution from the hierarchical Bayesian model
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Upper quartile (75 percentile of the posterior distribution) on the estimated change in number of breeding individuals over the trend period (usually 1970-2017), based on a combination of current population estimates and long-term trajectories. Median of the posterior distribution from the hierarchical Bayesian model
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: Population estimate of individuals in the United States and Canada, normally based on breeding season surveys, sometimes approximated depending on information provided by source
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: lower end of a 95% range of variation around population estimate
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: upper end of a 95% range of variation around population estimate
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: mean log of time-of-day adjustment factor, which is the ratio of peak/mean detection rates across 50 BBS stops
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: standard deviation of above mean log time-of-day adjustment factor
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: distance adjustment factor: A categorical adjustment assigned to each species to modify the presumed sampling radius and adjust density estimates based on expected detection distance
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313

columndescription: pair adjustmemt factor, based on proportion of males and females detected on surveys; ranges from 1 (both sexes detected equally) to 2 (only males detected)
reference: Rosenberg, K. V., Dokter, A. M., Blancher, P. J., Sauer, J. R., Smith, A. C., Smith, P. A., Stanton, J. C., Panjabi, A., Helft, L., Parr, M., & Marra, P. P. (2019). Decline of the North American avifauna. Science, 366(6461), 120–124. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aaw1313
